content:
• Monday, December 12, 2011
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural Resources (NYSE:PXD) and Pioneer Southwest Energy Partners (PSE) announce a...

    Pioneer Natural Resources (NYSE:PXD) and Pioneer Southwest Energy Partners (PSE) announce a combined secondary offering of 4.4M common units. PXD +1.5%, PSE -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) shares surge after the apparel and accessories retailer says in a...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) shares surge after the apparel and accessories retailer says in a regulatory filing its comparable retail segment net sales are “mid-single-digit positive" so far in Q4. URBN +9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • GILD

    YM BioSciences (YMI) surges 21.9% AH after reporting positive results for the Phase I/II study...

    YM BioSciences (YMI) surges 21.9% AH after reporting positive results for the Phase I/II study of its CYT387 drug for treating myleofibrosis, both with regards to efficacy and safety. The company hopes to start "pivotal trials" for the drug in mid-2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • GME

    GameStop (GME +2.1%) outperformed today on the back of positive NPD data. The firm estimates...

    GameStop (GME +2.1%) outperformed today on the back of positive NPD data. The firm estimates U.S. retail video game software sales (exc. digital downloads) rose 15% Y/Y in November, beating analyst estimates and representing a sharp reversal from earlier in the year. NPD also reported the Xbox 360 (NASDAQ:MSFT) was easily the top-selling console for yet another month, with U.S. sales of 1.7M units.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • NAVB

    Neoprobe (NEOP) jumps 4.5% AH after announcing it has licensed worldwide exclusive rights to...

    Neoprobe (NEOP) jumps 4.5% AH after announcing it has licensed worldwide exclusive rights to AstraZenaca's (NYSE:AZN) AZD4694 patient imaging solution, and plans to initiate Phase III trials in early 2013. Neoprobe will pay AstraZanaca a $5M up-front licensing fee, as well as future milestone payments and royalties.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • ST

    Sensata Technologies (NYSE:ST) falls 2.1% AH after warning its Q4 revenue will fall $20M-$25M...

    Sensata Technologies (NYSE:ST) falls 2.1% AH after warning its Q4 revenue will fall $20M-$25M short of the mid-point of its prior guidance range, and its EPS $0.03-$0.05 short of its prior guidance mid-point. The sensor maker blames production and inventory cuts among its automotive customers, due to a combination of Thai flooding and macro uncertainty.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • MWE

    MarkWest Energy Partners (NYSE:MWE) drops 3.4% AH after announcing its intent to acquire the 49%...

    MarkWest Energy Partners (NYSE:MWE) drops 3.4% AH after announcing its intent to acquire the 49% interest in its MarkWest Liberty Midstream JV that it doesn't already own. MarkWest will finance the deal by paying $1B in cash, and issuing 20M Class B shares. It expects the deal to be "up to 6% accretive in 2013 and beyond."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • X

    U.S. Steel Corp (X -5%) has settled a court case with the government of Canada that started when...

    U.S. Steel Corp (X -5%) has settled a court case with the government of Canada that started when Ottawa sought to fine the firm in 2009 for breaking job-protection promises made when it bought Canadian steelmaker Stelco. Under the terms of the settlement, the company will to maintain its Canadian operations until 2015, and spend an extra $49M in capital and facilities investment.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • UAA

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -4.3%) finish lower after William Blair notes several retailers...

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -4.3%) finish lower after William Blair notes several retailers marked many of its products down by roughly 20% last week. The firm believes the discounts so far have largely been a reflection of warmer-than-normal weather as well as high retailer inventory, which has created a more promotional environment in general on cold weather apparel.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Energy stocks (XLE -2.7%) have now surpassed financials as the day's weakest sector as concerns...

    Energy stocks (XLE -2.7%) have now surpassed financials as the day's weakest sector as concerns grow that Europe's debt crisis could lead to "a recession that could significantly inhibit oil demand," oil trading adviser Ritterbusch says. Among the day's biggest losers: ANR -9.3%, BTU -6.1%, CAM -5.9%, HAL -4.7%, NOV -3.8%, BHI -3.8%, OXY -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • DWDP

    Shares of DuPont (DD -2.6%) are lower today on a Barron's article over the weekend saying the...

    Shares of DuPont (DD -2.6%) are lower today on a Barron's article over the weekend saying the company's earnings are likely to remain under pressure in 2012 as customers cut spending. Separately, JP Morgan cut its price target on the shares to $56, reflecting sharply falling demand in the electronics segment and inventory corrections at auto OEM suppliers affecting polymer volumes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -3.6%) trades lower after being downgraded to Neutral from Buy on...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -3.6%) trades lower after being downgraded to Neutral from Buy on valuation at Pritchard Capital. Today's dip is hardly a blip on the radar however, when you consider the tear the stock has been on recently - gaining nearly 150% since early October.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • ATGE

    DeVry (DV -1.7%) says total Fall 2011 enrollment fell 5.9% from a year ago, with new...

    DeVry (DV -1.7%) says total Fall 2011 enrollment fell 5.9% from a year ago, with new undergraduate enrollment suffering a double-digit drop. The company cites weak economic conditions and new regulations as reasons for the dip, as for-profit colleges suffer a plunge in enrollments after being required to pull back on aggressive recruiting practices amid criticism related to high student-loan default rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • AMZN

    Consumers critical of Amazon's (AMZN -2.1%) Kindle Fire - complaining, for example, that there...

    Consumers critical of Amazon's (AMZN -2.1%) Kindle Fire - complaining, for example, that there is no external volume control and the off switch is easy to hit by accident - compel NYT's David Streitfeld to compare the tablet to the Edsel. Hyperbole, perhaps - was the Edsel no. 2 in sales of U.S. autos at its launch? - but Amazon says it will release a software update within two weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -4%) take a hit from a downgrade to Neutral at Lazard Capital, citing...

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -4%) take a hit from a downgrade to Neutral at Lazard Capital, citing competitive pressures in its Atlantic City market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • ZAGG

    Online mobile device retailer Zagg (ZAGG -8.3%) is trading lower today after announcing it's...

    Online mobile device retailer Zagg (ZAGG -8.3%) is trading lower today after announcing it's appointed Randall Hales as the company's new president and COO, and promoted Derek Smith to the position of CMO. Both will be assuming their roles immediately.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • DMND

    The ongoing saga of Diamond Foods (DMND -21.5%) takes another twist after a SEC filing (13G)...

    The ongoing saga of Diamond Foods (DMND -21.5%) takes another twist after a SEC filing (13G) reveals Wellington upped its stake in the packaged foods firm to 13.6% with recent buys.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • JBLU

    Shares of JetBlue (JBLU +1.7%) cross over into positive territory after the carrier reports an...

    Shares of JetBlue (JBLU +1.7%) cross over into positive territory after the carrier reports an increase in traffic for November of 10.9% Y/Y, on a jump in capacity of 7.7% over the same time period.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • NBL

    Shares of Rosetta Resources (ROSE -12.4%) slide after the oil and natural gas producer forecasts...

    Shares of Rosetta Resources (ROSE -12.4%) slide after the oil and natural gas producer forecasts a production increase for next year but issues disappointing results from its Southern Alberta exploratory well program. ROSE sets a capital budget of $640M for 2012, “much higher" than expected at Howard Weil, which cut its share price estimate to $53 from $55.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • INCY

    Shares of Incyte (INCY +4.4%) rally with the help of a reiteration by analysts at Jefferies of a...

    Shares of Incyte (INCY +4.4%) rally with the help of a reiteration by analysts at Jefferies of a Buy rating and the announcement that the firm is presenting positive results for its ruxolitinib treatment for various cancers at a Hematology conference today.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMTL

    Comtech (CMTL -1%) drift lower after Raymond James downgrades the stock to Market Perform,...

    Comtech (CMTL -1%) drift lower after Raymond James downgrades the stock to Market Perform, citing lack of near-term catalysts, and lower Q2 bookings and order trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • MLNX

    Shares of EZchip Semiconductor (EZCH -1.1%) are slightly lower but still outperforming the...

    Shares of EZchip Semiconductor (EZCH -1.1%) are slightly lower but still outperforming the general market after Auriga raises its rating to Buy, citing strength in the company's router product cycle at Cisco and customer-driven growth potential of the edge router segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS -3.4%) CEO Harold Hughes weighs in on the jury verdict that went against it in a...

    Rambus (RMBS -3.4%) CEO Harold Hughes weighs in on the jury verdict that went against it in a price-fixing lawsuit the firm filed against Hynix and Micron (NASDAQ:MU). He says during a CC that attorneys lost momentum in the case due to the long wait for a trial but will still evaluate options for a possible appeal.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • RBCN

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN +0.8%) are up this morning after Sterne Agee ups its rating...

    Shares of Rubicon Technology (RBCN +0.8%) are up this morning after Sterne Agee ups its rating to Neutral on valuation. The firm says it sees limited downside to the stock given that it is 55% lower than where it started the year, mostly due to sagging demand, and a snap-back could quickly drive pricing and margins higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • ARRY

    Array BioPharma (ARRY +2.4%) trades up after announcing positive results from Phase 1 and 2...

    Array BioPharma (ARRY +2.4%) trades up after announcing positive results from Phase 1 and 2 testing of its kinesin spindle protein inhibitor, ARRY-520, yesterday at the annual meeting of the American Society of Hematology in San Diego, California.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -6.1%) retreats again as Ganaxi Capital reports the company has fallen out of favor...

    Pandora (P -6.1%) retreats again as Ganaxi Capital reports the company has fallen out of favor with fund managers right and left. Shares now trade just a hair above their alltime closing low.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • NORNQ

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR -4%) gets a nod from Bank of America after the firm reinstates coverage...

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR -4%) gets a nod from Bank of America after the firm reinstates coverage with a resounding Buy rating and $11 price target. Analysts point out that the aluminum producer ranks lowers on the cost curve among peers in the U.S. and 2nd lowest in the world.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (PLL-OLD +1.2%) gains as Credit Suisse ups its price target by 11% to $68 on the back of...

    Pall (PLL-OLD +1.2%) gains as Credit Suisse ups its price target by 11% to $68 on the back of the company's solid FQ1 earnings report on Friday. The firm says operating margins sould see even more bottom-line improvement, driven by productivity gains and reduced SG&A expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • GRPN

    Data provider Yipit downwardly revises its original estimate of Groupon's (GRPN -6.1%) October...

    Data provider Yipit downwardly revises its original estimate of Groupon's (GRPN -6.1%) October gross billings because it accidentally double-counted some of the online daily deal company's more complex deals involving multiple price points. Yipit now says gross billings rose just 1.5% to $147M, vs. previous 22% to $176M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • SLF

    Canadian insurer Sun Life (SLF +1.9%) bucks a weak tape after the company assuages investor...

    Canadian insurer Sun Life (SLF +1.9%) bucks a weak tape after the company assuages investor fears by announcing plans to maintain its dividend. Separately, the company says it will stop selling variable-annuity and life insurance policies in the US.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • FXE

    In the wake of the Fitch statement, the euro touches its lowest point since early October, now...

    In the wake of the Fitch statement, the euro touches its lowest point since early October, now at $1.3186. Any further fall will send the currency back to its level of last January, when it was on the rise as the Fed was in the midst of QE and the ECB was getting ready to tighten. FXE -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • CUB

    Cubic (CUB -3.3%) signs its largest-ever $120M contract with a major Middle East customer to...

    Cubic (CUB -3.3%) signs its largest-ever $120M contract with a major Middle East customer to provide comprehensive marksmanship and small arms training capabilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Rumors circulate that Jefferies' (JEF -1.9%) workforce has been cut by 11%, but shares are...

    Rumors circulate that Jefferies' (JEF -1.9%) workforce has been cut by 11%, but shares are outpacing other banks (XLF -3%) as CreditSights says JEF is considering increasing its level of disclosures made through its financial reports to address concerns about exposure to riskier credits. CreditSights echoes Fitch in saying JEF should be able to weather recent problems.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • TIVO

    Caris' David Miller likes TiVo's (TIVO -2.8%) upcoming launch of boxes that work with DirecTV's...

    Caris' David Miller likes TiVo's (TIVO -2.8%) upcoming launch of boxes that work with DirecTV's satellite TV service so much he's upgrading the shares, reversing his September downgrade, and raising his target to $12 from $10. The combo-box "will quench pent-up demand within the DTV sub base for trick-play functionality on two tuners while enabling HD recording capabilities," Miller writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • AVGO

    Avago Technologies (AVGO -3.8%) dips after Morgan Stanley cuts its rating to Equalweight. Morgan...

    Avago Technologies (AVGO -3.8%) dips after Morgan Stanley cuts its rating to Equalweight. Morgan says a lack of near-term catalysts within its wireless business coupled with dilutive gross margins is likely to mitigate any near-term strength in its storage, data center switching and enterprise markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • LOW

    Lowe's (LOW -1.9%) faces some backlash after pulling ads from a reality show centered on...

    Lowe's (LOW -1.9%) faces some backlash after pulling ads from a reality show centered on American Muslims after a conservative group complained about the program's so-called propaganda. A state senator from California is holding Lowe's feet under the fire, labeling the action by the home improvement retailer as a form of discrimination.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 7 Comments
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +2.7%) trades against the grain after saying earlier it's entered...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +2.7%) trades against the grain after saying earlier it's entered into a 20-year agreement with GAIL India to sell about 3.5M metric tons of liquefied natural gas annually.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM

  • Gold suffers its worst selloff in 2 months, down 3.1% to $1,665/ounce as risk is very much off...

    Gold suffers its worst selloff in 2 months, down 3.1% to $1,665/ounce as risk is very much off this morning. We forget, is gold supposed to rise or fall when financial markets turn south? On the industrial side, copper slides as well, -3.2% to $3.44/pound.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 13 Comments
  • ATML

    Atmel (ATML -2.8%) underperforms after Collins Stewart's John Vinh speculates HTC (OTC:HTCCF)...

    Atmel (ATML -2.8%) underperforms after Collins Stewart's John Vinh speculates HTC (OTC:HTCCF) will stop using Atmel's touchscreen controller chips, in favor of chips made by either SYNA or CY, in order to circumvent patents held by Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL). The ITC's final ruling on a infringement complaint levied by Apple against HTC is due on Wednesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • VMC

    Shares of Vulcan Materials (VMC +24.7%) soar following the announcement of  MLM's hostile...

    Shares of Vulcan Materials (VMC +24.7%) soar following the announcement of  MLM's hostile bid - hitting circuit breakers several times along the way. Martin Marietta Materials (NYSE:MLM) trades 5.8% higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • NX

    Quanex Building Products (NX -5.2%) trades down after its FQ4 misses estimates on higher...

    Quanex Building Products (NX -5.2%) trades down after its FQ4 misses estimates on higher material costs and weak sales in its aluminum-sheet unit. The company adds that it still faces a soft market going into 2012 due to stagnant home-construction activity and a difficult economic environment, which, in turn, could pose a risk to current guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +7.3%) is soaring on market chatter of Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and/or Verizon...

    Netflix (NFLX +7.3%) is soaring on market chatter of Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and/or Verizon (NYSE:VZ) making a play for the company. "I doubt it," tweets one of Seeking Alpha's Netflix watchers, Rocco Pendola.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 7 Comments
  • BAC

    The cost to insure some of Bank of America's (BAC -3.9%) debt with credit default swaps has...

    The cost to insure some of Bank of America's (BAC -3.9%) debt with credit default swaps has sometimes surpassed that of Spring 2009, Heard on the Street's David Reilly writes: "There is a growing feeling support may not be there, as it was in 2009, if trouble strikes... [that] investors aren't so sure too-big-to-fail banks will always deserve that moniker."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 7 Comments
  • ARX

    Aeroflex (ARX -8.1%) takes a hit after Morgan Stanley cuts the stock to underweight. Morgan says...

    Aeroflex (ARX -8.1%) takes a hit after Morgan Stanley cuts the stock to underweight. Morgan says defense spending cuts pose an elevated risk to earnings in 2012, and the company isn't likely to meet earnings guidance in the second half. The firm is also lowering its 2012 EPS estimate to $0.99 from $1.12.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • ING

    ING (ING -9.1%) offers to buy back and exchange $7.7B of debt in an effort to bolster its...

    ING (ING -9.1%) offers to buy back and exchange $7.7B of debt in an effort to bolster its reserves, in a complex deal which will allow the bank to improve its capital levels without raising additional funds. The Dutch bank follows competitors such Lloyds, BNP Paribas and Commerzbank to exchange their own debt at discounted values and use the gains to strengthen capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas Partners (FGP -4.1%) dips on a Raymond James downgrade to Underperform, citing high...

    Ferrellgas Partners (FGP -4.1%) dips on a Raymond James downgrade to Underperform, citing high propane costs, a difficult operating environment and an increase in leverage versus its peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • EW

    Shares of Edwards Lifesciences (EW +4.5%) jump higher on the strength of multiple analyst...

    Shares of Edwards Lifesciences (EW +4.5%) jump higher on the strength of multiple analyst upgrades (I,II). Morgan Keegan points to the firm's strong product pipeline and prospects in China in lining up an Outperform rating, while Canacccord Genuity upgrades to Buy as it warms up to the risk/reward proposition offered by the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • BYI

    Bally Technologies (BYI +1.9%) pokes out a gain after catching an upgrade from JP Morgan to...

    Bally Technologies (BYI +1.9%) pokes out a gain after catching an upgrade from JP Morgan to Overweight from Neutral. The firm is one of many in the sector that have been lined up by analysts as possible outperformers if a bill to legalize online gambling passes Congress in the future.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • INTC

    "We don't think (the Thai floods are) going to have an impact on PC market sales in the 4th...

    "We don't think (the Thai floods are) going to have an impact on PC market sales in the 4th quarter," said Intel (INTC -4.2%) on its Q3 conference call, following which, company insiders sold heavily, notes Firstadopter. "Why does the skeptic in me want to think the warning is using the hard drive shortage as a convenient scapegoat," says Herb Greenberg. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (CRM -4.4%) is cut to Underperform at Cowen, citing slowing billings at a company...

    Salesforce.com (CRM -4.4%) is cut to Underperform at Cowen, citing slowing billings at a company “in the early stages of growing pains." After missing billings expectations in Q3, CRM changed its renewal policy to annual payments, which could positively impact billings in FY2013 via "the artificial one-time inflation of deferred revenue, but is likely a sign of longer-term pressure on the business.”

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +12.6%) pops after forming a partnership with Spanish conglomerate Abengoa...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +12.6%) pops after forming a partnership with Spanish conglomerate Abengoa to develop megawatt-class fuel cell power plants for Europe and Latin America. The companies expect to complete a distribution agreement related to the partnership in the next 6 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • ALV

    Autoliv (ALV -2.8%) trades lower after announcing Chairman and ex-CEO Lars Westerberg is...

    Autoliv (ALV -2.8%) trades lower after announcing Chairman and ex-CEO Lars Westerberg is resigning. Westerberg, who was appointed in 2007, will remain until a new Chairman is appointed.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA -0.4%) shares are raised to Overweight by Morgan Stanley on the assumption the...

    Boeing (BA -0.4%) shares are raised to Overweight by Morgan Stanley on the assumption the company will be able to quadruple its cash flow next year and boost its dividend. "Key pluses" at Boeing - orders, cash flow, earnings achievability - "look better" than the overall aerospace sector; total free cash flow could hit $10B-$11B, raising the odds for a dividend hike. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) -24% premarket after saying it won’t file its 10-Q on time...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) -24% premarket after saying it won’t file its 10-Q on time because its audit committee hasn’t completed a review of how the nut company accounts for payments it makes to walnut growers. Because DMND won’t meet the SEC deadline for its quarterly report, the company expects to be temporarily booted to a lower tier of Nasdaq.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stocks move aggressively lower after Intel cuts Q4 guidance; S&P futures now...

    Market preview: Stocks move aggressively lower after Intel cuts Q4 guidance; S&P futures now -1.2%. Skepticsm about the eurozone's fiscal union deal from Moody's, S&P and others already sent EU shares and U.S. futures lower, and yields on peripheral eurozone bonds higher. The dollar +1.1% vs. the euro, which, along with technical selling, causes gold to fall 2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) +11.9% premarket after it says a subsidiary reached an agreement...

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG) +11.9% premarket after it says a subsidiary reached an agreement to sell 3.5M tonnes of liquefied natural gas annually for 20 years to Gail Ltd., an Indian state-run gas transmission and marketing firm. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • INTC

    Stock futures take a new leg down as Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) cuts Q4 guidance, expecting revenue of...

    Stock futures take a new leg down as Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) cuts Q4 guidance, expecting revenue of $13.4B-$14B against a previous estimate of $14.2B-$15.2B. The firm blames a reduction in inventories and microprocessor purchases across the PC supply chain due to hard disc drive supply shortages. Shares -3.4% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 5 Comments
  • ANIP

    Shares of BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) are a premaker mover, up 3.7%, after a SEC filing tips...

    Shares of BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) are a premaker mover, up 3.7%, after a SEC filing tips off that Kopp Investment trimmed its stake in the firm. The specialty pharmaceutical firm has drawn increasing notice from fund managers looking for bets in the biotech sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • ABB

    Shares of ABB fall off 2% premarket after the Swiss firm snapped up Newave for CHF 170M ($184M)...

    Shares of ABB fall off 2% premarket after the Swiss firm snapped up Newave for CHF 170M ($184M) to broaden its position in the uninterruptible power supply market. The acquisition is just the latest in a string of deals as the firm starts to put its large cash position - $1B at the end of Q3 - to work.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • ENDP

    Endo Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:ENDO) gains 6.2% after stating the FDA has approved a...

    Endo Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:ENDO) gains 6.2% after stating the FDA has approved a crush-resistant version of its Opana pain-relief drug, which will be patent-protected until Nov. 2023. Concerns have existed about the potential for the non-crush-resistant version of Opana to be abused.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • TPX

    Oppenheimer gives a lift to Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) with an upgrade to Outperform and a price...

    Oppenheimer gives a lift to Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) with an upgrade to Outperform and a price target of $70 - repping 33% upside potential. Analysts with the firm call investor concerns on the beat-up stock "overstated and manageable." Shares +1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARIA) reports positive results from a study of its experimental...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARIA) reports positive results from a study of its experimental leukemia drug ponatinib. Data showed improved response rates from patients following treatment. Shares +3.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • ONXX

    The FDA says Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) hasn't conducted the necessary trials to get a...

    The FDA says Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) hasn't conducted the necessary trials to get a quick review of its cancer drug carfilzomib, and instead will have to settle for a standard review period. Shares -8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) announces that it lined up an order from Etihad Airways for ten 787 Dreamliners...

    Boeing (NYSE:BA) announces that it lined up an order from Etihad Airways for ten 787 Dreamliners and two 777 Freighters in a deal valued at $2.8B. The UAE carrier expects to take delivery of the aircraft starting in 2014. Shares of BA -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM

    In a long-awaited report, the FSA slams RBS (NYSE:RBS) and U.K. regulators over RBS'...

    In a long-awaited report, the FSA slams RBS (NYSE:RBS) and U.K. regulators over RBS' near-collapse in 2008 following its takeover of ABN Amro. The watchdog listed six reasons for RBS' failure, including over-reliance on risky short-term wholesale funding and weaknesses in the bank's capital position. RBS -5.5% in London. (RBS response)
